line-height: 115%;"> </span></strong><strong>Transfer of credit from other Universities and Institutes of Religion: </strong><strong>Religion credit earned at C.E.S. Institutes of Religion or other Church schools will transfer as elective credit when the following conditions are met: (1) a letter grade is given; (2) the earned letter grade appears on the BYU-Idaho transcript. Students completing courses at the BYU Jerusalem Center or Nauvoo may receive up to 6 earned credits in religion which will count toward the BYU-Idaho religion requirement. Coursework in religious studies from any place other than a LDS Church school or Institute of Religion will not be accepted toward filling the BYU-Idaho religion requirements.</strong></h4> <p><strong><a href="x41188.xml">Second Religion Class</a>: </strong>Taking two religion classes in a given term is discouraged but may be approved in cases of acedemic necessity. <strong><br /></strong></p> <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; line-height: normal; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><strong><span style="font-size: 8.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin;">Attendance</span></strong><span style="font-size: 8.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin;">: Each instructor may establish criteria for giving credit, but generally, lack of attendance would affect a student’s grade detrimentally and could result in no credit for the class, thus requiring the student to retake the class.</span></p> <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; line-height: normal;"><strong><span style="font-size: 8.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin;"> Waivers</span></strong><span style="font-size: 8pt;">: Should a student be denied a graduation diploma from BYU–Idaho because the religion credit was not completed <strong>and reasons for the non-completion were beyond the control of the student</strong>, an appeal may be submitted for review.<span> </span>For clarification and/or application for a wavier, see the Religon Department Chair. Students should make an appointment with the Department Secretary at (208) 496-3920</span><span></span></p>
